entry.title: Update: website is now mobile friendly
entry.summary: Now the website is much preattier on mobile platforms. A lot of imporvements are yet needed to get the website started. Please contact us if you have any suggestions.

entry.title: Testing ipython notebook
entry.summary:
This is an example of post using numpy I am using %pylab as default. What you see below it is a simple test where I am playing at plotting things related to the possion distribution. I am using scipyt.stats for the calculations and matplotlib for the plotting itself.

In [1]:
from scipy.stats import poisson as P
In [2]:
bins = arange(0, 5)
P.pmf(bins, 0.5)
Out[2]:
array([ 0.60653066,  0.30326533,  0.07581633,  0.01263606,  0.00157951])

Poisson distribuition¶

Again here I am inserting some markdown

In [ ]:
bins = arange(0, 5)
mean = 0.1
h = plt.vlines(bins, 0, P.pmf(bins, mean), lw=4, color='blue') # Probability Mass Function
ylabel("freq")

And here Markdown again but I am not executing it

In [6]:
mean = arange(0,5,0.01)
plot(mean, P.pmf(1, mean) - P.pmf(3, mean)- P.pmf(2, mean) - P.pmf(0, mean))
Out[6]:
[<matplotlib.lines.Line2D at 0x5767f0>]
In [7]:
mean = arange(0,2,0.001)
plot(mean, (P.pmf(1, mean)- P.pmf(2, mean))/P.pmf(1, mean))
Out[7]:
[<matplotlib.lines.Line2D at 0x868d8b0>]
In [8]:
count = 0
for i in arange(0.2,1,0.1):
    a = []
    bins = arange(0,5)
    vlines(bins + count,0, P.pmf(bins, i), color = cm.rainbow(i),lw=3, label = a.append(i))
    count += 0.1
In [33]:
bins = arange(0, 4)
mean = 1.0
h = plt.vlines(bins, 0, P.pmf(bins, mean), lw=8, color='blue') # Probability Mass Function
ylabel("freq")
plt.vlines([0.1,1.1,2.1,3.1], 0, array([12,8,6,0])/26., lw=8, color='red')
Out[33]:
<matplotlib.collections.LineCollection at 0xabe6290>

entry.title: First Post
entry.summary:
The website is under construction.

This is a simple test of a post. I thank you for your visit and I invite you to come back in the future when the blog will be ready. You will hopefully find a more developed website already on February 2015.

The purpose of this website is to offer "bits" of science reflections from different fields of natural science.

Below for you delightment and to the more practical purpose of testing the posting layout with a lon post.

The quotes are copy-pasted from Wikiquote-Galilei

Some years ago, as Your Serene Highness well knows, I discovered in the heavens many things that had not been seen before our own age.

The passage of time has revealed to everyone the truths that I previously set forth; and, together with the truth of the facts, there has come to light the great difference in attitude between those who simply and dispassionately refused to admit the discoveries to be true, and those who combined with their incredulity some reckless passion of their own.

Nature is inexorable and immutable; she never transgresses the laws imposed upon her, or cares a whit whether her abstruse reasons and methods of operation are understandable to men.
